Get Geom allowed aesthetics

All ggplot2 Geom objects have a set of allowable aesthetics that are used for generating the layer of the plot. This function returns those aesthetics, as well as any alternative localizations and base R equivalent names which can all be used as inputs to specify aesthetics to a ggplot object.

allowed_aesthetics(geom = NULL)

Arguments

geom

a ggplot2 Geom object or NULL

Value

a character vector of the names of aesthetics permitted by this geometry object (including alternative localizations of names and base R equivalent names also accepted by ggplot2). If geom is NULL, returns all of ggplot2)'s default allowed aesthetics.

See also

filter_aesthetics(), remove_aesthetics(), flatten_aesthetics_to_group(), add_eqv_aes(), split_aes_from_dots(), is_uneval()

Examples

library(ggplot2)
ggpackets:::allowed_aesthetics(GeomBar)
#>  [1] "x"        "y"        "group"    "colour"   "fill"     "size"    
#>  [7] "linetype" "alpha"    "col"      "color"    "cex"      "lty"     
#> [13] "lwd"      "bg"       "fg"

Contents
